</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Common Stock and Equity</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In July&nbsp;2007, the Company&#146;s Board of Directors authorized the repurchase of $100&nbsp;million of
the Company&#146;s common stock on the open market or in privately negotiated transactions. During
August&nbsp;2007, the Company repurchased 987,180 shares of its common stock at an average price of
$50.65 per share, for a total of $50&nbsp;million under the authorization. During May and June&nbsp;2007, the
Company repurchased 923,364 shares of its common stock on the open market at an average price of
$54.15 per share, for a total of $50&nbsp;million, the maximum amount permitted under the program
approved by the Board of Directors in December&nbsp;2005. All shares repurchased have been cancelled.
For each share of stock repurchased, an equal number of Operating Partnership units owned by the
Company were redeemed. Repurchases of common stock were financed through general corporate funds,
including borrowings under existing lines of credit. As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, $50&nbsp;million remained
of the July&nbsp;2007 authorization.
</DIV>

<!-- xbrl,n -->
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Note 15 &#151; Commitments and Contingencies</B>
</DIV>

<!-- xbrl,body -->
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Cash Tender</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At the time of the Company&#146;s initial public offering and acquisition of its partnership
interest in the Operating Partnership in 1992, the Company entered into an agreement (the Cash
Tender Agreement) with A. Alfred Taubman, who owns an interest in the Operating Partnership,
whereby he has the annual right to tender to the Company units of partnership interest in the
Operating Partnership (provided that the aggregate value is at least $50&nbsp;million) and cause the
Company to purchase the tendered interests at a purchase price based on a market valuation of the
Company on the trading date immediately preceding the date of the tender. At A. Alfred Taubman&#146;s
election, his family and certain others may participate in tenders. The Company will have the
option to pay for these interests from available cash, borrowed funds, or from the proceeds of an
offering of the Company&#146;s common stock. Generally, the Company expects to finance these purchases
through the sale of new shares of its stock. The tendering partner will bear all market risk if the
market price at closing is less than the purchase price and will bear the costs of sale. Any
proceeds of the offering in excess of the purchase price will be for the sole benefit of the
Company. The Company accounts for the Cash Tender Agreement between the Company and Mr.&nbsp;Taubman as
a freestanding written put option. As the option put price is defined by the current market price
of the Company&#146;s stock at the time of tender, the fair value of the written option defined by the
Cash Tender Agreement is considered to be zero.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based on a market value at December&nbsp;31, 2009 of $35.91 per common share, the aggregate value
of interests in the Operating Partnership that may be tendered under the Cash Tender Agreement was
approximately $913&nbsp;million. The purchase of these interests at December&nbsp;31, 2009 would have
resulted in the Company owning an additional 32% interest in the Operating Partnership.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Continuing Offer</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has made a continuing, irrevocable offer to all present holders (other than
certain excluded holders, including A. Alfred Taubman), assignees of all present holders, those
future holders of partnership interests in the Operating Partnership as the Company may, in its
sole discretion, agree to include in the continuing offer, all existing optionees under the
previous option plan, and all existing and future optionees under the 2008 Omnibus Plan to exchange
shares of common stock for partnership interests in the Operating Partnership (the Continuing
Offer). Under the Continuing Offer agreement, one unit of the Operating Partnership interest is
exchangeable for one share of the Company&#146;s common stock. Upon a tender of Operating Partnership
units, the corresponding shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock, if any, will automatically be
converted into the Company&#146;s common stock at a rate of 14,000 shares of Series&nbsp;B Preferred Stock
for one common share.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->F-36<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<!-- xbrl -->

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">TAUBMAN CENTERS, INC.<BR>
NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#151; (CONTINUED)
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Indemnification</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The disposition of Woodland in 2005 by one of the Company&#146;s Unconsolidated Joint Ventures was
structured in a tax efficient manner to facilitate the investment of the Company&#146;s share of the
sales proceeds in a like-kind exchange in accordance with Section&nbsp;1031 of the Internal Revenue Code
and the regulations thereunder. The structuring of the disposition has included the continued
existence and operation of the partnership that previously owned the shopping center. In connection
with the disposition, the Company entered into a tax indemnification agreement with the Woodland
joint venture partner, a life insurance company. Under this tax indemnification agreement, the
Company has agreed to indemnify the joint venture partner in the event an unfavorable tax
determination is received as a result of the structuring of the sale in the tax efficient manner
described. The maximum amount that the Company could be required to pay under the indemnification
is equal to the taxes incurred by the joint venture partner as a result of the unfavorable tax
determination by the IRS or the state of Michigan within their respective three and four year
statutory assessment limitation periods, in excess of those that would have otherwise been due if
the Unconsolidated Joint Venture had sold Woodland, distributed the cash sales proceeds, and
liquidated the owning entities. The Company cannot reasonably estimate the maximum amount of the
indemnity, as the Company is not privy to or does not have knowledge of its joint venture partner&#146;s
tax basis or tax attributes in the Woodland entities or its life insurance-related assets. However,
the Company believes that the probability of having to perform under the tax indemnification
agreement is remote. The Company and the Woodland joint venture partner have also indemnified each
other for their shares of costs or revenues of operating or selling the shopping center in the
event additional costs or revenues are subsequently identified.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Litigation</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In September&nbsp;2009, a restaurant owner filed a lawsuit in Superior Court of the State of
California for the County of Los Angeles (Case No.&nbsp;BC 421212) against Taubman Centers, Inc., the
Operating Partnership, and the Manager. The plaintiff is alleging breach of oral agreement,
promissory estoppel, specific performance, and fraud related to a proposed lease. The plaintiff is
seeking damages exceeding $10&nbsp;million, lost profits, restitution on its current lease, exemplary or
punitive damages, and specific performance. The lawsuit is in its early legal stages and the
Company is vigorously defending it. The outcome of this lawsuit cannot be predicted with any
certainty and management is currently unable to estimate an amount or range of potential loss that
could result if an unfavorable outcome occurs.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In April&nbsp;2009, two restaurant owners, their two restaurants, and their principal filed a
lawsuit in United States District Court for the Eastern District of Pennsylvania (Case No.&nbsp;CV01619)
against Atlantic Pier Associates LLC (&#147;APA&#148;, the owner of The Pier Shops), the Operating
Partnership, Taubman Centers, Inc., the owners of APA and certain affiliates of such owners, and a
former employee of one of such affiliates. The plaintiffs are alleging the defendants
misrepresented and concealed the status of certain tenant leases at The Pier Shops and that such
status was relied upon by the plaintiffs in making decisions about their own leases. The plaintiffs
are seeking damages exceeding $20&nbsp;million, rescission of their leases, exemplary or punitive
damages, costs and expenses, attorney&#146;s fees, return of certain rent, and other relief as the court
may determine. The lawsuit is in its early legal stages and the defendants are vigorously defending
it. The outcome of this lawsuit cannot be predicted with any certainty and management is currently
unable to estimate an amount or range of potential loss that could result if an unfavorable outcome
occurs.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;While management does not believe that an adverse outcome in either or both of the above
lawsuits would have a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s financial condition, there can be no
assurance that adverse outcomes would not have material effects on the Company&#146;s results of
operations for any particular period.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->F-37<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<!-- xbrl -->

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">TAUBMAN CENTERS, INC.<BR>
NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#151; (CONTINUED)
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On December&nbsp;8, 2009, West Farms Associates and West Farms Mall, LLC (together, &#147;Westfarms&#148;)
and The Taubman Company LLC (together with Westfarms, the &#147;WFM Parties&#148;) entered into a settlement
agreement (the &#147;Settlement Agreement&#148;) with three developers of a project called Blue Back Square
in West Hartford, Connecticut. The Settlement Agreement relates to a lawsuit originally filed by
the developers against the WFM Parties and related persons in November&nbsp;2007 in the Connecticut
Superior Court, Judicial District of Hartford at Hartford and subsequently transferred to the
Superior Court for the Judicial District of Waterbury at Waterbury. The developers alleged damages
in excess of $40&nbsp;million and sought double, treble, and punitive damages, as well as attorneys
fees. Pursuant to the Settlement Agreement, the lawsuit was withdrawn with prejudice upon payment
by Westfarms of $34&nbsp;million to the developers on December&nbsp;15, 2009. The Company has a 79%
investment in Westfarms Associates, an unconsolidated joint venture which owns Westfarms mall, and
the Company&#146;s share of the settlement was $26.8&nbsp;million. The developers, for themselves and on
behalf of related persons, agreed to a full and general release for the benefit of the WFM Parties
and related persons as of December&nbsp;8, 2009. There was no admission of liability or fault by any
parties to the lawsuit or related persons. In early November&nbsp;2007, the Town of West Hartford and
the West Hartford Town Council (the &#147;Town&#148;) filed a substantially similar lawsuit against the same
entities in the same court, which was also subsequently transferred to the Superior Court for the
Judicial District of Waterbury at Waterbury. The Town alleged damages in excess of $5.5&nbsp;million and
sought double, treble, and punitive damages, as well as attorneys fees. In January&nbsp;2010, the WFM
Parties executed a settlement agreement with the Town, which provided for a full and general
release for the benefit of the WFM Parties upon payment by Westfarms of $4.5&nbsp;million, or
$3.6&nbsp;million at the Company&#146;s share, which was recorded in 2009. There was no admission of
liability or fault by any parties to the lawsuit or related persons.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See Note 4 regarding The Pier Shops&#146; loan and the Company&#146;s Oyster Bay project, Note 8 for the
Operating Partnership&#146;s guarantees of certain notes payable and other obligations, Note 10 for
contingent features relating to derivative instruments, and Note 13 for obligations under existing
share-based compensation plans.
</DIV>

<!-- xbrl,n -->
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Note 16 &#151; Earnings (Loss) Per Share</B>
</DIV>

<!-- xbrl,body -->
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Basic earnings per share amounts are based on the weighted average of common shares
outstanding for the respective periods. Diluted earnings per share amounts are based on the
weighted average of common shares outstanding plus the dilutive effect of potential common stock.
Potential common stock includes outstanding partnership units exchangeable for common shares under
the Continuing Offer (Note 15), outstanding options for units of partnership interest, RSU, PSU,
and deferred shares under the Non-Employee Directors&#146; Deferred Compensation Plan (Note 13), and
unissued partnership units under unit option deferral election. In computing the potentially
dilutive effect of potential common stock, partnership units are assumed to be exchanged for common
shares under the Continuing Offer, increasing the weighted average number of shares outstanding.
The potentially dilutive effects of partnership units outstanding and/or issuable under the unit
option deferral elections are calculated using the if-converted method, while the effects of other
potential common stock are calculated using the treasury stock method.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, there were 8.7&nbsp;million partnership units outstanding and 0.9&nbsp;million
unissued partnership units under unit option deferral elections, that may be exchanged for common
shares of the Company under the Continuing Offer (Note 15). These outstanding partnership units and
unissued units were excluded from the computation of diluted earnings per share as they were
anti-dilutive in all periods presented. Also, there were 0.7&nbsp;million and 0.5&nbsp;million shares
representing the potentially dilutive effect of potential common stock under share-based
compensation plans (Note 13) excluded from the computation of diluted EPS for the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, respectively, because they were anti-dilutive due to net losses in 2009
and 2008.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->F-38<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<!-- xbrl -->

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">TAUBMAN CENTERS, INC.<BR>
NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#151; (CONTINUED)
</DIV>

<!-- xbrl,n -->
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Note 17 &#151; Fair Value Disclosures</B>
</DIV>

<!-- xbrl,body -->
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This note contains required fair value disclosures for assets and liabilities remeasured at
fair value on a recurring basis, assets that were remeasured at fair value on a nonrecurring basis
during the period, and financial instruments carried at other than fair value, as well as
assumptions employed in deriving these fair values.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Recurring Valuations</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><I>Derivative Instruments</I>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The fair value of interest rate hedging instruments is the amount that the Company would
receive to sell an asset or pay to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market
participants at the reporting date. The Company&#146;s valuations of its derivative instruments are
determined using widely accepted valuation techniques, including discounted cash flow analysis on
the expected cash flows of each derivative, and therefore fall into Level 2 of the fair value
hierarchy. The valuations reflect the contractual terms of the derivatives, including the period to
maturity, and use observable market-based inputs, including forward curves. The fair values of
interest rate hedging instruments also incorporate credit valuation adjustments to appropriately
reflect both the Company&#146;s own nonperformance risk and the respective counterparty&#146;s nonperformance
risk.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><I>Marketable Securities</I>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#146;s valuations of marketable securities, which are considered to be
available-for-sale, and an insurance deposit utilize unadjusted quoted prices determined by active
markets for the specific securities the Company has invested in, and therefore fall into Level 1 of
the fair value hierarchy.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis, quantitative
disclosure of the fair value for each major category of assets and liabilities is presented below:
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->F-39<!-- /Folio -->

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<!-- xbrl -->

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">TAUBMAN CENTERS, INC.<BR>
NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#151; (CONTINUED)
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The insurance deposit shown above represents an escrow account maintained in connection with a
property and casualty insurance arrangement for the Company&#146;s shopping centers, and is classified
within Deferred Charges and Other Assets. Corresponding deferred revenue relating to amounts billed
to tenants for this arrangement has been classified within Accounts Payable and Other Liabilities.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The available-for-sale securities shown above consist of $1.7&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2009 and
$1.4&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2008 of marketable securities that represent shares in a Vanguard REIT
fund that were purchased to facilitate a tax efficient structure for the 2005 disposition of
Woodland mall. In the second quarter of 2009, the Company concluded that a decrease in value was
other than temporary, and therefore recognized a $1.7&nbsp;million impairment loss.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Nonrecurring Valuations</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Pier Shops, Regency Square, and Oyster Bay investments represent the remaining book values
after recognizing non-cash impairment charges to write the investments to their fair values. The
fair values of the investments were determined based on discounted future cash flows, using
management&#146;s estimates of cash flows from operations, necessary capital expenditures, the eventual
disposition of the investments, and appropriate discount and capitalization rates (Note 4).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For assets measured at fair value on a nonrecurring basis, quantitative disclosure of the fair
value for each major category of assets is presented below:

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Financial Instruments Carried at Other Than Fair Values</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><I>Community Development District Obligation</I>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;One shopping center pays annual special assessment levies of a Community Development District
(CDD), which provided certain infrastructure assets and improvements. As the amount and period of
the special assessments were determinable, the Company capitalized the infrastructure assets and
improvements and recognized an obligation for the future special assessments to be levied. At
December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, the book value of the infrastructure assets and improvements, net of
depreciation, was $45.8&nbsp;million and $48.1&nbsp;million, respectively. The related obligation is
classified within Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities and had a balance of $63.3&nbsp;million and
$63.9&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, respectively. The fair value of this obligation,
derived from quoted market prices, was $59.8&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2009 and $51.2&nbsp;million at
December&nbsp;31, 2008.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->F-40<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<!-- xbrl -->

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">TAUBMAN CENTERS, INC.<BR>
NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#151; (CONTINUED)
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><I>Notes Payable</I>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The fair value of notes payable is estimated based on quoted market prices, if available. If
no quoted market prices are available, the fair value of mortgages and other notes payable are
estimated using cash flows discounted at current market rates. When selecting discount rates for
purposes of estimating the fair value of notes payable at December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, the Company
employed the credit spreads at which the debt was originally issued plus an additional 2% credit
spread to account for current market conditions. This additional spread is an estimate and is not
necessarily indicative of what the Company could obtain in the market at the reporting date. The
Company does not believe that the use of different interest rate assumptions would have resulted in
a materially different fair value of notes payable as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 or 2008. To further
assist financial statement users, the Company has included with its fair value disclosures an
analysis of interest rate sensitivity. The fair values of the loans on The Pier Shops and Regency
Square, at December&nbsp;31, 2009, have been estimated at the fair value of the centers, which are
collateral for the loans (Note 4).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The estimated fair values of notes payable at December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008 are as follows:
</DIV>

<!-- xbrl,n -->
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Note 20 &#151; New Accounting Pronouncements</B>
</DIV>

<!-- xbrl,body -->
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In June&nbsp;2009, the FASB made changes to ASC Topic 810 &#147;Consolidation&#148; (ASC 810). These changes
eliminate certain scope exceptions previously permitted, provide additional guidance for
determining whether an entity is a variable interest entity, and require companies to more
frequently reassess whether they must consolidate variable interest entities. The changes also
replace the previously required quantitative approach to determining the primary beneficiary of a
variable interest entity with a requirement for an enterprise to perform a qualitative analysis to
determine whether the enterprise&#146;s variable interest or interests give it a controlling financial
interest in a variable interest entity. Changes are effective as of the beginning of the first
annual reporting period that begins after November&nbsp;15, 2009, for interim periods within that first
annual reporting period, and for interim and annual reporting periods thereafter. Earlier
application is prohibited. The Company anticipates that the new accounting will not have an effect
on its results of operations or financial position, as the Company does not currently have any
variable interest or interests that give it a controlling financial interest in a variable interest
entity in accordance with ASC 810.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In September&nbsp;2009, the FASB ratified the EITF&#146;s consensus on &#147;Multiple-Deliverable Revenue
Arrangements&#148;, contained in Accounting Standards Update No.&nbsp;2009-13. This consensus amends previous
accounting guidance on separating consideration in multiple-deliverable arrangements. This
consensus eliminates the residual method of allocation in previous guidance and requires that
arrangement consideration be allocated at the inception of the arrangement to all deliverables
using the relative selling price. This consensus also establishes a selling price hierarchy based
on available evidence for determining the selling price of a deliverable, (i)&nbsp;first on
vendor-specific objective evidence, (ii)&nbsp;then third party evidence, and (iii)&nbsp;then the estimated
selling price. This consensus also requires that a vendor determine its best estimate of selling
price in a manner that is consistent with that used to determine the price to sell the deliverable
on a standalone basis. This consensus is effective prospectively for revenue arrangements entered
into or materially modified in fiscal years beginning on or after June&nbsp;15, 2010. Early adoption is
permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the application of the EITF&#146;s consensus on its
results of operations and financial position.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->F-42<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left">(1)</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>These centers are collateral for the Company&#146;s $550&nbsp;million line of credit. Borrowings
under the line of credit are primary obligations of the entities owning these centers.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left">(2)</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In 2009, the Company wrote down The Pier Shops at Caesars and Regency Square to their fair
values. The impairment charges were $107.7&nbsp;million and $59.0&nbsp;million, respectively.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left">(3)</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>As a result of the impairments of The Pier Shops and Regency Square in 2009, the related
accumulated depreciation was set to zero.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left">(4)</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In 2008, the Company recognized a $117.9&nbsp;million impairment charge on the Oyster Bay project.
The remaining balance of $39.8&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 is included in development
pre-construction costs.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left">(5)</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The unaudited aggregate costs for federal income tax purposes as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 was
$3.696&nbsp;billion.</TD>
</TR>

<TR style="font-size: 3pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left">(6)</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Includes costs related to The Pier Shops at Caesars, which became a consolidated center in
2007.</TD>
</TR>

    <TD valign="top" align="center"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">*10(bb)

<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.S

<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10ws</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10 (s)
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">ANNEX TO SECOND AMENDMENT TO THE SECOND<BR>
AMENDMENT AND RESTATEMENT OF AGREEMENT OF<BR>
LIMITED PARTNERSHIP OF THE TAUBMAN<BR>
REALTY GROUP LIMITED PARTNERSHIP<BR>
<U>Designation, Distribution, Redemption, Exchange, and Consent Provisions</U><BR>
<U>with Respect to the 9% Series&nbsp;C Cumulative Redeemable Preferred Equity</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS ANNEX (this &#147;<U>Annex</U>&#148;) TO THE SECOND AMENDMENT (the &#147;<U>Second Amendment</U>&#148;) TO
THE SECOND AMENDMENT AND RESTATEMENT OF AGREEMENT OF LIMITED PARTNERSHIP OF THE TAUBMAN REALTY
GROUP LIMITED PARTNERSHIP (as amended through the date hereof, the &#147;<U>Partnership
Agreement</U>&#148;), entered into effective September&nbsp;3, 1999, serves as a further amendment to the
Partnership Agreement entered into pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1(c) of the Partnership Agreement, and is
made by, between, and among TAUBMAN CENTERS, INC., a Michigan corporation (&#147;<U>TCO</U>&#148;), TG
PARTNERS LIMITED PARTNERSHIP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#147;<U>TG</U>&#148;), and TAUB-CO
MANAGEMENT, INC., a Michigan corporation (&#147;<U>Taub-Co</U>&#148;), who, as the Appointing Persons,
pursuant to Section&nbsp;13.11 of the Partnership Agreement, have the full power and authority to amend
the Partnership Agreement on behalf of all of the Partners of The Taubman Realty Group Limited
Partnership, a Delaware limited partnership (the &#147;<U>Partnership</U>&#148;), with respect to the
matters herein provided. (Capitalized terms used herein that are not herein defined, shall have
the meanings ascribed to them in the Partnership Agreement.)
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;On September&nbsp;3, 1999, TCO, TG, and Taub-Co entered into the Second Amendment to provide for
the contribution of preferred capital to the Partnership in exchange for a preferred equity
interest, and for certain other purposes.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;Pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.1(c) of the Partnership Agreement and as authorized by Section&nbsp;13.11
of the Partnership Agreement, the parties hereto wish to enter into this Annex to
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --><!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>



<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">provide for the
designation, distribution, redemption, exchange, and consent
provisions with respect to that certain series of Parity Preferred Equity herein designated as &#147;9%
Series&nbsp;C Cumulative Redeemable Preferred Equity.&#148;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are
hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(i) <I>Designation</I>: There is hereby established a series of Parity Preferred Equity designated &#147;9%
Series&nbsp;C Cumulative Redeemable Preferred Equity&#148; (the &#147;<U>Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity</U>&#148;). The
Parity Preferred Rate with respect to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity is hereby designated as nine
percent (9%) per annum. The Parity Preferred Return in respect of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity is
hereinafter referred to as the &#147;<U>Series&nbsp;C Return</U>.&#148; The holder of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Equity is hereinafter referred to as the &#147;<U>Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner</U>.&#148; The Parity
Preferred Equity Balance of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner is hereinafter referred to as the
&#147;<U>Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance</U>&#148;. The Unpaid Parity Preferred Return of the Series&nbsp;C
Preferred Partner is hereinafter referred to as the &#147;<U>Unpaid Series&nbsp;C Preferred Return</U>&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(ii) <I>Payment of Distributions/Allocations: </I>The Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner shall be entitled to
receive cumulative cash distributions equal to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Return. Such distributions
shall accrue from the date of the contribution to the Partnership of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity,
and shall be payable when, as and if determined by the Managing General Partner, on or before the
last Day of each March, June, September, and December of each Partnership Fiscal Year (a
&#147;<U>Distribution Date</U>&#148;) and on a priority basis as against all distributions other than those
required to be made under the Partnership Agreement and other than distributions required by any
series of Preferred Equity existing as of the date hereof or any other series of Parity Preferred
Equity. The amount of the distribution payable for any period shall be computed on the basis of a
360-Day year of twelve 30-Day months and for any period shorter than a full quarterly period for
which distributions are computed, the amount
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">of the distribution payable shall be computed on the
basis of the actual number of days elapsed in such a 30-Day month. If any date on which
distributions are to be made on the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity is not a
Business Day, then payment of the distribution to be made on such date shall be made on the next
succeeding Day that is a Business Day (and without any interest or other payment in respect of any
such delay) except that, if such Business Day is in the next succeeding Partnership Fiscal Year,
such payment shall be made on the immediately preceding Business Day, in each case with the same
force and effect as if made on such date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no distribution shall be
made to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner which would reduce its Adjusted Capital Account Balance
below zero. Distributions on the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity shall be made to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Partner of record on the fifteenth (15<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP>) Day of the calendar month in which the
applicable Distribution Date falls or such other date established by the Managing General Partner
for determining the holders of record of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity for such distribution (the
&#147;<U>Distribution Record Date</U>&#148;), which date shall not be more than thirty (30)&nbsp;Days nor less
than ten (10)&nbsp;Days prior to such Distribution Date. In the event of the issuance of Series&nbsp;C
Preferred Stock (as defined below), the Distribution Record Date for the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity
shall be the Dividend Record Date (as defined in the Restated Articles of Incorporation of TCO, as
amended) for the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock. Unpaid Series&nbsp;C Preferred Return will not compound.
The Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance distributed to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner pursuant to
Section&nbsp;11.1(a)(5) of the Partnership Agreement shall be computed after giving effect to a
&#147;book-up&#148; of all Partnership assets to their respective fair market values and allocations under
the Partnership Agreement of Profits and Losses resulting therefrom.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In no event shall Profits for any Partnership Fiscal Year allocated to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Partner exceed nineteen and 95/100ths percent (19.95%) of the Profits of the Partnership for such
Partnership Fiscal Year (the &#147;<U>19.95% Profits Allocation Limit</U>&#148;), provided however, that the
19.95%
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Profits Allocation Limit will not apply to TCO. Further, in applying Section 704(c) of the
Code with respect to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner, the Partnership shall, consistent with the
requirements of the applicable Regulations, utilize a reasonable method of allocation, provided
that such method shall not have the effect of allocating to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner a
greater amount of taxable income for any
Partnership Fiscal Year than the amount of Profits allocated to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner for
such Partnership Fiscal Year.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>Optional Redemption:</I></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;<I>Partnership&#146;s Redemption Right</I>: The Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity is not redeemable prior to
September&nbsp;3, 2004. On or after September&nbsp;3, 2004, the Partnership, at its option, upon not less
than thirty (30)&nbsp;nor more than sixty (60)&nbsp;Days&#146; written notice, may redeem the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Equity, in whole or in part, at any time and from time to time, at a redemption price (the
&#147;<U>Redemption Price</U>&#148;), payable in cash equal in amount to the amount of contributed capital
plus Unpaid Series&nbsp;C Preferred Return, in each case, with respect to that portion of the Series&nbsp;C
Preferred Equity Balance being redeemed. Immediately prior to such redemption, the Capital
Accounts of the Partnership shall be adjusted to give effect to a &#147;book-up&#148; of all Partnership
assets to their respective fair market values and allocations under the Partnership Agreement of
Profits and Losses resulting therefrom. If less than all of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity is
redeemed, the Capital Account of the holder of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity shall, as a result of
the redemption, be reduced by only the portion of such Capital Account attributable to the interest
redeemed.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;<I>Limitations on Redemption</I>:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless the accrued Series&nbsp;C Return has been distributed in full for all quarterly distribution
periods terminating on or prior to the date of redemption, the Partnership may not redeem less than
the entire outstanding amount of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Equity. Further, the Redemption Price
(other than the portion thereof consisting of Unpaid Series&nbsp;C Preferred
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->4<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Return) shall be payable
solely out of the sale proceeds of other &#147;partnership interests&#148; of the Partnership, or &#147;capital
stock&#148; of TCO. For purposes of the preceding sentence, the term &#147;partnership interests&#148; and
&#147;capital stock&#148; means any equity securities of the Partnership and/or TCO, respectively (including
&#147;Units of Partnership Interests&#148;, &#147;preferred equity interests&#148;, &#147;common stock&#148; and &#147;preferred
stock&#148;), shares, interest, participation, or other ownership interests (however designated)
and any rights (other than debt securities convertible into or exchangeable for equity
securities) or options to purchase any of the foregoing.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C)&nbsp;<I>Procedure for Redemption</I>: Notice of redemption shall be (i)&nbsp;faxed and (ii)&nbsp;mailed by the
Partnership, by certified mail, postage prepaid, not less than thirty (30)&nbsp;nor more than sixty (60)
Days prior to the Redemption Date (as defined below), addressed to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner
at its address as it appears on the records of the Partnership. In addition to any information
required by law, each such notice shall state: (a)&nbsp;the redemption date (the &#147;<U>Redemption
Date</U>&#148;), (b)&nbsp;the Redemption Price, (c)&nbsp;the percentage of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity to be
redeemed, and (d)&nbsp;the place where a Certificate of Withdrawal in the form of Exhibit&nbsp;1 hereto, is
to be delivered in exchange for payment of the Redemption Price.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Partnership gives a notice of redemption in respect of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity or
any portion thereof (which notice shall be irrevocable) then, by 12:00 noon, New York City time, on
the Redemption Date, the Partnership shall deposit irrevocably in trust for the benefit of the
Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner funds sufficient to pay the Redemption Price and shall give irrevocable
instructions and authority to pay such Redemption Price to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner upon
delivery of a Certificate of Withdrawal at the place designated in the notice of redemption. If
any date fixed for redemption of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity is not a Business Day, then payment
of the Redemption Price shall be made on the next succeeding Business Day (without any interest or
any payment in respect of any such delay) except that if such Business Day falls in the next
calendar year, such payment shall be made on the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->5<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">immediately preceding Business Day, in each case
with the same force and effect as if made on the Redemption Date. If payment of the Redemption
Price is improperly withheld or refused and not paid by the Partnership, the Series&nbsp;C Return on the
portion of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity to be redeemed shall continue to accrue from the
Redemption Date to the date of payment, in which case the actual payment date will be considered
the date fixed for redemption in the redemption notice for purposes of calculating the applicable
Redemption Price.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">(iv)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>Exchange Rights</I>:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;<I>Right to Exchange</I>:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;The Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity shall be exchangeable in whole but not in part unless
expressly otherwise provided herein at any time on or after September&nbsp;3, 2009 for Series&nbsp;C
Preferred Stock of TCO (the &#147;<U>Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock</U>&#148;) at an exchange rate (the
"<U>Exchange Rate</U>&#148;) of Seventy Five Dollars ($75) of Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance (as
computed after giving effect to a &#147;book-up&#148; of all Partnership assets to their respective fair
market values and allocations under the Partnership Agreement of Profits and Losses resulting
therefrom but in no event shall such Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance (as so computed) exceed an
amount equal to the capital contribution plus any Unpaid Series&nbsp;C Preferred Return) for one (1)
share of Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock to be delivered by TCO, subject to adjustment as described below.
In the event of an exchange, the Unallocated Series&nbsp;C Preferred Return shall be reduced to zero.
At such time as TCO receives approval to amend its Restated Articles of Incorporation, as amended,
to increase the number of authorized shares of Preferred Stock (as defined therein), and further
amends such Restated Articles of Incorporation, as amended, by increasing the number of shares of
Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock to Two Million (2,000,000) shares, which amendments TCO has undertaken to
use its commercially reasonable efforts to cause to
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">be made, the Exchange Rate will be reduced to
Thirty-Seven and 50/100 Dollars ($37.50). The terms of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock shall be as
set forth on Schedule&nbsp;A attached hereto. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Equity shall become exchangeable at any time, in whole but not in part unless expressly provided
otherwise herein, for Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock if (x)&nbsp;at any time the accrued Series&nbsp;C Return shall
not have been distributed in full to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner with respect to six (6)&nbsp;prior
quarterly distribution periods, whether or not consecutive, provided, however, a distribution of
the Series&nbsp;C Return shall be considered timely if made within two (2)&nbsp;Business Days after the
Distribution Date for the Series&nbsp;C Return if at the time of such late payment there shall not
be any prior quarterly distribution periods in respect of which the full amount of the accrued
Series&nbsp;C Return was not timely made or (y)&nbsp;upon receipt by the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner of (a)
notice from the Managing General Partner that the Partnership has taken the position that the
Partnership is, or upon the consummation of an identified event in the immediate future will be
taxable as a corporation and (b)&nbsp;an opinion rendered by independent counsel familiar with such
matters addressed to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner that the Partnership is or likely is, or upon
the occurrence of an identified event in the immediate future will be or likely will be, taxable as
a corporation. The Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity may be exchanged, in whole but not in part, for
Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock if the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner concludes at any time that there exists
in the reasonable judgment of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner an imminent and substantial risk that
the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner&#146;s interest in the Partnership represents or will represent more than
nineteen and 95/100ths percent (19.95%) of the capital or profits of the Partnership determined in
accordance with Regulations Section&nbsp;1.731-2(e)(4). In addition, if the Partnership sells in one
(1)&nbsp;or more taxable transactions two (2)&nbsp;or more properties on Schedule&nbsp;E to the Partnership
Agreement, and after giving effect to such sales or exchanges (and related tax distributions by the
Partnership) it is reasonably expected that the net income of the Partnership as computed on
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->7<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">the
basis of tax depreciation and not book depreciation will be below $33.75&nbsp;million for the taxable
year of the sale or the next succeeding taxable year, then the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity shall be
exchangeable, in whole, but not in part, at the exchange rate set forth above. Further, the Series
C Preferred Equity shall be exchangeable, in whole but not in part at the exchange rate set forth
above, if the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner, in its reasonable judgment, determines that less than
ninety percent (90%) of the gross income of the Partnership for any taxable year will or will
likely constitute &#147;qualifying income&#148; within the meaning of Section 7704(d) of the Code.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in Paragraph (iv)(A)(1) above, if an
Exchange Notice (as defined below) has been delivered to TCO, then
TCO may, at its option, within thirty (30)&nbsp;Business Days after receipt of the Exchange Notice,
purchase directly or elect to cause the Partnership to redeem, all or a portion of the outstanding
Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity by redeeming or, as applicable, purchasing, the corresponding portion of
the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance (in each case, as computed after giving effect to a &#147;book-up&#148;
of all Partnership assets to their respective fair market values and allocations under the
Partnership Agreement of Profits and Losses resulting therefrom) for cash in an amount equal to the
Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance or portion thereof being redeemed.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;In the event an exchange of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity would violate the provisions on
ownership limitation of TCO as set forth in the Restated Articles of Incorporation of TCO, as
amended, the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner shall be entitled to exchange, pursuant to the provisions
of Paragraph (iv)(A)(1) hereof, a percentage of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance that would
comply with the provisions on ownership limitation of TCO and any portion of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Equity Balance not so exchanged (the &#147;<U>Excess Preferred Equity</U>&#148;) shall be redeemed by the
Partnership for cash in an amount equal to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance allocable to the
Excess Preferred Equity, subject to any
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->8<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">restriction thereon contained in any debt instrument or
agreement of the Partnership and provided that such redemption would not adversely impact the
rating of any outstanding debt of the Partnership.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>(B)&nbsp;Procedure for Exchange and/or Redemption of Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity:</I>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;Any exchange shall be exercised pursuant to a notice of exchange (the &#147;<U>Exchange
Notice</U>&#148;) delivered to TCO by the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner by (a)&nbsp;fax and (b)&nbsp;by certified
mail, postage prepaid. TCO may effect any exchange of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity or exercise its
option to cause the Partnership to redeem any portion of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity for cash
pursuant to Paragraph (iv)(A)(2) above or redeem Excess Preferred Equity pursuant to Paragraph
(iv)(A)(3) above by delivering to the Preferred Equity Partner, within thirty (30)&nbsp;Business Days
after receipt of the Exchange Notice, (a)&nbsp;if TCO elects to acquire any of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Equity then outstanding,
(1)&nbsp;a written notice stating (A)&nbsp;the date of the exchange, which may be the date of such
written notice or any other date which is not later than sixty (60)&nbsp;Days after the receipt of the
Exchange Notice, and (B)&nbsp;the place where the Certificate of Withdrawal is to be delivered and (2)
certificates representing the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock being issued in exchange for the Series&nbsp;C
Preferred Equity and corresponding Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance being exchanged, or (b)&nbsp;if TCO
elects to cause the Partnership to redeem all of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity then outstanding in
exchange for cash or elects to cause the Partnership to redeem any Excess Preferred Equity for
cash, a written notice stating (1)&nbsp;the redemption date, which may be the date of such written
notice or any other date which is not later than sixty (60)&nbsp;Days after the receipt of the Exchange
Notice, (2)&nbsp;the redemption price, and (3)&nbsp;the place where the Certificate of Withdrawal is to be
delivered. The Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity shall be deemed canceled simultaneously with the delivery
of the Certificate of Withdrawal (with respect to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance exchanged)
or simultaneously with the redemption date (with respect to Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance
</DIV>




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->9<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">redeemed). Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, any and all Series&nbsp;C
Preferred Equity to be exchanged for Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock pursuant to this Paragraph (iv)&nbsp;shall
be so exchanged in a single transaction at one (1)&nbsp;time. As a condition to exchange, TCO may
require the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner to make such representations and warranties including,
without limitation, warranties as to ownership and absence of restrictions, liens, and encumbrances
and representations as may be reasonably necessary for TCO to establish that the issuance of Series
C Preferred Stock pursuant to the exchange shall not be required to be registered under the
Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#147;<U>Securities Act</U>&#148;), or any state securities laws.
Any Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock issued pursuant to this Paragraph (iv)&nbsp;shall be delivered as shares
which are duly authorized, validly issued, fully paid, and nonassessable, free of any pledge, lien,
encumbrance or restriction other than those provided in the Restated Articles of Incorporation, as
amended, the Restated By-Laws of TCO, the Securities Act, and relevant state securities or blue sky
laws. The certificates representing the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Stock issued upon exchange of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity shall contain the following
legend:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE AMENDED AND RESTATED ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, AS THE SAME MAY BE AMENDED (THE
&#147;ARTICLES&#148;), IMPOSE CERTAIN RESTRICTIONS ON THE TRANSFER AND OWNERSHIP OF THE SHARES REPRESENTED BY
THIS CERTIFICATE BASED UPON THE PERCENTAGE OF THE OUTSTANDING SHARES OWNED BY THE SHAREHOLDER. AT
NO CHARGE, ANY SHAREHOLDER MAY RECEIVE A WRITTEN STATEMENT OF THE RESTRICTIONS ON TRANSFER AND
OWNERSHIP THAT ARE IMPOSED BY THE ARTICLES.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE SHARES REPRESENTED BY THIS CERTIFICATE MAY NOT BE TRANSFERRED, SOLD, ASSIGNED, PLEDGED,
HYPOTHECATED, OR OTHERWISE DISPOSED OF EXCEPT (A)&nbsp;PURSUANT TO AN EFFECTIVE REGISTRATION STATEMENT
UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, AS AMENDED (THE &#147;ACT), OR (B)&nbsp;IF THE
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->10<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">CORPORATION HAS BEEN
FURNISHED WITH A SATISFACTORY OPINION OF COUNSEL FOR THE HOLDER OF THE SHARES REPRESENTED HEREBY,
OR OTHER EVIDENCE SATISFACTORY TO THE CORPORATION, THAT SUCH TRANSFER, SALE, ASSIGNMENT, PLEDGE,
HYPOTHECATION, OR OTHER DISPOSITION IS EXEMPT FROM THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 5 OF THE ACT AND THE
RULES AND REGULATIONS THEREUNDER.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;In the event of an exchange of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity for Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock,
fractional Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock of TCO is not to be issued upon the exchange but, in lieu
thereof, TCO shall pay a cash adjustment based on the fair market value of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Stock on the Day prior to the exchange date as determined in good faith by the Board of Directors
of TCO.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3) <I>Adjustment of Exchange Price</I>. In the event that TCO shall be a party to any transaction
(including, without limitation, a merger, consolidation, statutory share exchange, tender offer for
all or substantially all of TCO&#146;s capital stock, or sale of all or substantially all of TCO&#146;s
assets), in each case as a result of which the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock will be converted into the
right to receive shares of capital stock, other securities or
other property (including cash or any combination thereof), the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity
Balance will thereafter be exchangeable into the kind and amount of shares of capital stock and
other securities and property receivable (including cash or any combination thereof) upon the
consummation of such transaction by a holder of that number of Series&nbsp;C Preferred Stock of TCO or
fraction thereof into which the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance was exchangeable immediately
prior to such transaction. TCO may not become a party to any such transaction unless the terms
thereof are consistent with the foregoing.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(v) <I>No Other Conversion Rights</I>. Subject to TCO&#146;s right to convert the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity
Balance to an Additional Interest pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.1(c) of the Partnership
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->11<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Agreement, the
Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner shall not have any right to convert the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity
Balance or any portion thereof into any other securities of, or interest in, the Partnership.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(vi) <I>No Sinking Fund</I>: No sinking fund shall be required for the retirement or redemption of the
Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(vii) <I>Certain Voting Rights: </I>The Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner shall not have any voting rights or
rights to consent to any Partnership matter requiring the consent or approval of Partners, except
as set forth below.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;So long as any Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance remains outstanding, the Partnership shall
not, without the affirmative vote of Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partners holding at least two-thirds
(2/3rds) of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity Balance at the time, (x)&nbsp;authorize or create, or increase
the authorized or issued amount of, any class or series of Partnership Interests ranking senior to
the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity with respect to payment of distributions or rights upon liquidation,
dissolution, or winding up (including, without limitation, any future issuances of Preferred
Equity), or reclassify any Partnership Interests of the Partnership into any such Partnership
Interest, or create, authorize or issue any obligations or security convertible into or
exchangeable for or evidencing the right to purchase any such Partnership Interests, (y)
consolidate, merge into or with, or convey, transfer or lease its assets substantially as an
entirety to, any corporation or other entity,
or amend or alter Sections&nbsp;1.2, 1.3, 1.4, 5.1, 5.2(a)(i), 5.5, 5.7(a), 6.10, 8.1(a), 8.1(c), or
11.1(a)(5) of the Partnership Agreement or any other sections of the Partnership Agreement which
would affect such sections, or the rights or obligations of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner under
the Partnership Agreement, or this Annex, whether by merger, consolidation, amendment or otherwise,
in each such case in a manner that would materially and adversely affect the rights of the Series&nbsp;C
Preferred Equity or the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner; provided, however, that with respect to the
occurrence of any event set forth
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->12<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">in clause (y)&nbsp;above, so long as (1)&nbsp;the Partnership is the
surviving entity and the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity remains outstanding with the terms thereof
unchanged, or (2)&nbsp;the resulting, surviving or transferee entity is a partnership, limited liability
company, or other pass-through entity organized under the laws of any state and substitutes for the
Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity other interests in such entity having substantially the same terms and
rights as the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity, including with respect to distributions, redemptions,
transfers, voting rights, and rights upon liquidation, then the occurrence of any such event shall
not be deemed to materially and adversely affect such rights of the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Partner; and
provided further, that any increase or issuance in the amount of Partnership Interests or the
creation or issuance of any other class or series of Partnership Interests, in each case ranking
(a)&nbsp;junior to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity with respect to payment of distributions or the
distribution of assets upon liquidation, or (b)&nbsp;on a parity to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred Equity with
respect to payment of distributions or the distribution of assets upon liquidation shall not be
deemed to materially and adversely affect such rights.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein or in the Partnership Agreement, in
determining what is a class or series ranking senior, or on parity to the Series&nbsp;C Preferred
Equity, the 19.95% Profits Allocation Limit shall be disregarded.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->13<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned Appointing Persons, in accordance with Section&nbsp;13.11 of
the Partnership Agreement, on behalf of all of the Partners have entered into this Annex as of the
date first above written.
</DIV>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">/s/ Robert S Taubman</TD>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.V
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>k48898exv10wv.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.V
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wv</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV style="font-family: Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10 (v)
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>FIRST AMENDMENT<BR>
TO<BR>
THE SECOND AMENDMENT AND RESTATEMENT OF AGREEMENT OF LIMITED PARTNERSHIP <BR>
OF THE TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP LIMITED PARTNERSHIP</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">THIS FIRST AMENDMENT (this &#147;Amendment&#148;) TO THE SECOND AMENDMENT AND RESTATEMENT OF AGREEMENT OF
LIMITED PARTNERSHIP OF THE TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP LIMITED PARTNERSHIP (the &#147;Partnership Agreement&#148;)
is made as of the 4th day of March, 1999 by, between, and among TAUBMAN CENTERS, INC., a Michigan
corporation, TG PARTNERS LIMITED PARTNERSHIP, a Delaware limited partnership, and TAUB-CO
MANAGEMENT, INC., a Michigan corporation, who as the Appointing Persons pursuant to Section&nbsp;13.11
of the Partnership Agreement have the full power and authority to amend the Partnership Agreement
on behalf of all the partners in the Partnership with respect to the matters provided in this
Amendment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>RECITALS:</B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">A. On September&nbsp;30, 1998, the parties to this Amendment entered into the Partnership
Agreement as an amendment and restatement of the then-existing partnership agreement (the
&#147;Amended and Restated Agreement&#148;) of The Taubman Realty Group Limited Partnership, a
Delaware limited partnership (the &#147;Partnership&#148;), as authorized under Section&nbsp;13.11 of the
Amended and Restated Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">B. As authorized under Section&nbsp;13.11 of the Partnership Agreement, the parties wish to amend
the Partnership Agreement to facilitate a proposed pledge of Units of Partnership Interest
in the Partnership.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, the parties, intending to be legally bound, agree that the Partnership
Agreement is amended as set forth below.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;8.1 (b)&nbsp;of the Partnership Agreement is amended by inserting the following as the
third and final paragraph of Section&nbsp;8.1 (b):</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In addition to the foregoing, in connection with a financing transaction, any Record Partner
(other than TCO) may pledge some or all of the Units of Partnership Interest that such
Record Partner owns on the effective date of the pledge (the &#147;Pledge Units&#148;) to any Person
(the &#147;Pledgee&#148;), subject to the restrictions set forth in this paragraph of Section&nbsp;8.1 (b).
Before effecting the pledge of any Pledge Units, the pledging Partner must first receive a
Transfer Determination with respect to the pledge, and the Pledgee must irrevocably agree,
pursuant to a written instrument acceptable to the Managing General Partner, that (A)&nbsp;unless
(i)&nbsp;the Pledgee is a Person described in the preceding paragraphs of this Section&nbsp;8.1 (b)&nbsp;as
a Person to whom a Partner may Transfer its Partnership Interest (a &#147;Permitted Transferee&#148;)
and (ii)&nbsp;the Managing General Partner has agreed, in writing, to the admission of the
Pledgee as a substitute Partner with respect to some or all of the Pledge Units upon a
default under the loan to be secured by the pledge of Pledge Units, (B)&nbsp;the Pledgee (1)
shall not, at any time, have or exercise any rights as a Partner with respect to any of the
Pledge Units (including any right to consent or vote with respect to any matter affecting
the Partnership), other than (a)&nbsp;the right to receive any distributions from the Partnership
that are or may be payable with respect to the, Pledge Units as and when the same become
payable and (b)&nbsp;the right to receive the return of any contribution to which the pledging
Partner would be entitled with respect to the Pledge Units, and (2)&nbsp;shall not, upon the
pledging Partner&#146;s default or otherwise, have any right (or claim or attempt to exercise any
right) to Transfer (or cause the Transfer of) the Pledge Units (or any interest in the
Pledge Units) other than to TCO in exchange for Equity Shares or another Permitted
Transferee.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The parties confirm that the Partnership Agreement, as expressly amended by this Amendment,
is and shall remain in full force and effect.</TD>
</TR>



</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

written above.
